displaytitle: Gerrit Dircksz. or Claes Steffensz. Heussen
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
Collector's stamp and date in brown ink, verso upper center: F. Gawet (Lugt 1070) 1825

Collector stamp in brown ink, verso lower left: A.F. von Lanna (Lugt 2773)

Collector stamp in black ink, verso lower center: Alexander Danz (Lugt 103)
inscribed: In margin around oval: FORTVNE EST TELLE AET. SV. 27.

titles.title: Gerrit Dircksz. or Claes Steffensz. Heussen

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Franz Gawet [1765-1847, Lugt 1070]. Possibly Alexander Danz [?-ca. 1880, Lugt 103]; Adalbert von Lanna [1836-1909, Lugt 2773]; sale of his collection, Stuttgart, May 11-22, 1909, possibly lot 1817; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.

bibliography.boilertext: F.W.H. Hollstein, "Goltzius-Heemskerck," Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings, and woodcuts, ca. 1450-1700, (Amsterdam: M. Hertzberger, 1953).
